result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander James Scorby was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: La Crosse County Clerk of Courts
parties.address: 333 Vine St, Room 1200, La Crosse, WI 54601

miscConds.notes:
The State has 60 days to determine restitution amount - if no amount is determined in 60 days, it will be set at $0

Pay 10% restitution surchasrge to the DA's office

Restitution will be paid under the terms of a payment plan to be established with the PO but calling for no less than 2.5% of gross wages to be paid toward restitution and to be enforced through a wage assignment
.

Obtain and maintain full-time employment or enroll in a course of education or a combination of both that is full-time.  If not working or in school, the defendant must do Community Service work in addition to the 100 hours already ordered
.

Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random testing

No Contact with users/dealers/traffickers of illicit drugs or controlled substances

No Contact with R.G. or T.G. or B.P. or their residence

The defendant is not to be present at any location where illicit drugs or controlled substances are kept, used, stored or trafficked, including vehicles
.

The Court wants to wait to see how the defendant handles probation.  If the def completes probation successfully, he can request 973.015 treatment and the Court will make the final finding
.

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

No sentence credit if probation is ever revoked

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Alexander James Scorby
Current: 603 N 10th St, La Crosse, WI 54601 United States  (Effective: 02-25-2016)
Prior: N5011 Oakview Dr, West Salem, WI 54669

Def in court w/Atty Peter Brian Kisken.  Noel Ann Lawrence appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Ct. 1 - forgery - Guilty
remaining charges dismissed and read in
SNP filed/signed/understands
  Plea Quest filed/signed/understands
Understands const rights waived
Understands elements of crime
No promises/threats
No alc/drugs in the last 24 hrs 
 Plea is F, V & I made. Sufficient factual basis to support the plea and the def is found guilty.
LAWRENCE: Ask to follow the recommendations in the SNP. KISKEN: he's still on probation on another matter. DEF: I talked myself into believing it was a valid check. I didn't know forgery or uttering was even a charge until I met the people I was dealing w/ but I knew it was wrong. CRT: I have seen you before and i know early on your parents were at every crt proceeding and I believe that relationship has changed. CRT: the focus today is on rehab but if you come back after a rev of the probation then the goal is changed to protection of the public. 
SENTENCE:
Sentence withheld - 2 yrs probation
Cond:   Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations. NC w/ drug users/dealers or traffickers of controlled or illicit substances and R & T G.  or their residence or B Panek;   The def is not to consume any alc and/or controlled substances w/o a valid Rx; random testing; not to be present where any controlled or illicit subs are kept,  used, stored, trafficked including vehicles; The Def is to obtain and maintain full time employment or enroll in a course of education or a combination of both or com service; 100 hrs com service. Pay DOC fees & CC. DNA referral given. There is no credit. State has 60 days for rest. If none w/in 60 days that will be a 0. Will find that he will benefit, was under 25 yrs old at the time of the offense.  I can't find that society won't be harmed. I will want to wait and see how he handles probation.  If he completes probation successfully he can request that I make the final finding.

11:08 am - Def in court w/Atty Peter Brian Kisken.  Rukmini Vasupuram appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Prelim waiver filed - signed/understands.  No promises/threats.
COURT finds Waiver FV & I made -  Probable cause found - Bound over for trial.
Information filed - Reading waived.  Def Stands Mute - NG Pleas entered.
PTC:   2/12/16 @ 1:30 (DA)
STC: 3/3/16 @ 10am (SLH)

Def in custody w/atty Krueger
  Pretrial report filed
Sig bond to cont w/added cond: no contact w/B.P
PH: 1/11 @ 11 (SLH)

State by Hynek / Def NA
CRT:  Warrant issued for $1000 cash
Signature Bond signed by Def w/ no conditions;  IA 12-17-15 @ 1:30
